title: Art campaign begins today!
summary: The Art Campaign officially launches today, inviting children and young people to express their views on poverty through art.
details: The Art Campaign: Poverty, starting today, aims to empower children and young people to share their experiences and perspectives on poverty. Through artistic expression, participants can highlight the difference between poverty and neglect. This campaign, organized in collaboration with CCYP and local communities, includes an online and physical art exhibition, and selected works will be displayed during Anti-Poverty Week.

title: Social media submissions for artworks now open!
summary: Participants can now submit their artwork for the Art Campaign via social media platforms using #Kidspovertyperspectives #CCYPWApostcards.
details: Starting today, young participants can share their artworks on social media platforms such as Instagram, Twitter, and Facebook using the hashtag #Kidspovertyperspectives #CCYPWApostcards. This initiative encourages wider community engagement and allows the public to vote for their favorite artworks. The top submissions will be featured on this website and displayed at local library exhibitions.
